text:
María Aurelia Paula Martínez Suárez, known professionally as Silvia Legrand (23 February 1927 – 1 May 2020), was an Argentine movie actress. She co-starred with her twin sister Mirtha Legrand, in many movies and was the sister of director José A. Martínez Suárez. She starred in some 20 movies between 1940 and 1972. Legrand was known for her roles in "Educating Niní" (1940) and in "Seven Women" (1944).
Legrand died of cardiac arrest on 1 May 2020 in Buenos Aires, aged 93.
